repeater.note1: Please use standard browser - Edge, Chrome, Safari or Firefox to ensure PDJ Media Repeater can work correctly.
repeater.note2: For Android Phone in China, please use Official
repeater.note3: Other browsers may not support uttering translation lines with system TTS(will auto switch to online TTS service), or may hijack video or audio tag to make PDJ media repeater losing control of the media file.

repeater.replayFromStart: SingleClick to Replay Current Sentence from the First Time
repeater.autoPauseAfterFirstDone: AutoPause After Uttering Translation Line or Playing Current Sentence Firstly, And Click To Continue.
repeater.playFullFavList: Play All Favorite Sentenses in Current User's Root Folder When Playing Favorite List (In this mode, autoPlay current sentence is not allowed due to browser's restriction.)
repeater.allowCache: Cache Media - Enable to Save Visited Media Files in Browser's Cache. This will hugely save traffic usage in the next visit, but will take up storage space on this device (After this setting is changed, it will automatically reload current page to make it effective). In 'Offline APP Mode', 'Cache Media' will be selected automatically and cannot be changed.
repeater.cached1: Max number of latest files to cache:
repeater.savedfiles: Number of media files saved in this Browser's Cache: {numOfKeys}
repeater.offlineApp: Offline APP Mode: This mode will prioritize the use of files in the browser cache. When there are no required files in the cache, they will be downloaded from the server and stored in the browser cache (If the server cannot be accessed, these files will not be displayed). When this mode is turned off, regardless of whether there is a cache of the required files in the browser, the server files will be used again to verify and update the browser cache (Resources in the 'media cache' are stored in a dedicated database and are not controlled by this). This mode can be used normally when the client cannot connect to the internet or the server is shut down, and will not generate any traffic, but can only use files in the cache. This mode can still perform editing subtitles and settings when there is no network, and it will automatically update to the server after connecting to the server. In this mode, when resources have been cached and changes are made to the resources on the server, even if the network is normal, the cache will not be able to synchronize updates. You can turn off this mode to synchronize the modified resources on the server to the browser cache. This mode will automatically log in using the cached account information.
repeater.addnewWord: Add a New Word or Phrase
repeater.instruction1: Click (DOWN arrow key on keyboard): replay current sentence
repeater.instruction2: DoubleClick (UP arrow key on keyboard): stop playing
repeater.instruction3: Swipe Left (RIGHT arrow key on keyboard): jump to next sentence
repeater.instruction4: Swipe Right (LEFT arrow key on keyboard): jump to previous sentence
repeater.instruction5: Swipe Up: add to favorites (Or remove a favorite when playing Favorite List)
repeater.instruction7: : switch Playback Mode between 'Single Sentence Repetition Mode' and 'Regular Mode'. The RED icon indicates the media file stored in the browser cache is being played.
repeater.instruction8: : switch Subtitle in 8 Modes. Especially, while editing in red Mode, you can practice DICTATION.
repeater.instruction9: : show SETTINGS, INSTRUCTIONS, UPDATES and COMMENTS
repeater.instruction13: : edit subtitle and annotation, add or remove a new word or phrase
repeater.instruction11: : add or remove a favorite sentence.
repeater.instruction12: : show Subtitle List, New Words Test or New Words List. Click the item in the list to switch Current Sentence.
repeater.learnLangUsingPDJ: To Learn A Language Using PDJ Media Repeater
repeater.learnLang1: There are two very effective methods to learn a language: Shadowing and Reciting. For shadowing, you need listen to a sentence firstly, and then repeat it yourself immediately (maybe in mind). For reciting, you need read or listen to a sentence in your mother language firstly, and then translate to the new language immediately.
repeater.learnLang2: The key to the success of these two methods lies in REPETITION, a large amount of REPETITION, until a permanent conditioned reflex is formed! For the same sentence, you need to repeat shadowing and reciting it again and again (maybe 100 times in a year) to make it as familiar as your mother language. This is a boring and time-consuming job with no obvious effects in short time.
repeater.learnLang3: With PDJ Media Repeater, you can do shadowing and reciting easier, and the 'Review' function will ensure that you can obtain efficient and sufficient repetition times. Just choose a video or audio with 20-50 sentences every week, and repeat shadowing and reciting them every morning and evening 2 or 3 times. You can lie in your bed, close your eyes, and click, or swipe left, up in your cell phone to learn the language. Thus, in one year, you may master thousands of sentences as fluent as your mother language. That will be a big improvement.
repeater.confirmDelete: Are you sure to delete Current Sentence?
repeater.confirmMerge: Are you sure to merge Current Sentence to Next Sentence?
repeater.confirmAdd: Are you sure to add a New Sentence after Current Sentence?
repeater.infoMerge: Merge Current Sentence to Next Sentence
repeater.infoAdd: Add a New Sentence after Current Sentence
repeater.RUdoAlert: Done! When restoring deleted or merged sentence, the favorite status may not be restored correctly, please adjust manually.
repeater.cleanCacheDone: Selected caches have been cleaned up!
repeater.cleanAccount: Clear the login info in browser cache. Then, login in 'Offline APP mode' will not be disabled.
repeater.cleanMedia: Clear cached media files in browser!
repeater.cleanSrtandSettings: Clear other files in browser cache, including subtitles and settings that have been modified in 'Offline APP mode' with a disconnected server but may not have been synchronized to the server yet!
repeater.cleanAlert: Attention: Please do not change the server file directory structure! Otherwise, it may need to manually delete the user's PDJ-userX.txt file on the server, and add sentence favorites and review plans again, and use browser 'refresh' button to force update the cache to ensure PDJ Media Repeater can work properly.
repeater.favoriteClearConfirm: When using the PDJ media repeater for the first time, a new configuration file {favFileName} will be automatically created in this user's root folder! The PDJ media repeater will automatically cache accessed data for offline use, which can be cleared on the login page. Meanwhile, when using the subtitle editing function, the original. srt file will be modified. If necessary, please make a backup in advance. Click 'Confirm' to continue, click 'Cancel' to exit.
repeater.speechsynthesisAlert: Sorry, your browser does not support 'speechSynthesis API', and it can't utter the subtitle's translation line with system embedded TTS. You can use official Firefox browser in Android phone (especially in China), Safari in iPhone, and Chrome/Edge in windows PC
repeater.warning1: Video or audeo tag is hijacked by this browser. This browser may not fully comply with HTML5 standard. Please restart your browser to retry. Or change to a standard browser: Edge, Chrome, Safari or Firefox to ensure PDJ Media Repeater can work correctly.

settings.allowEdit: Edit, rename and delete files or directories
settings.brandingHelp:
You can customize how your File Browser instance looks and feels by changing its name, replacing the logo, adding custom styles and even disable external links to GitHub.
For more information about custom branding, please check out the {0}.
settings.commandRunnerHelp: Here you can set commands that are executed in the named events. You must write one per line. The environment variables {0} and {1} will be available, being {0} relative to {1}. For more information about this feature and the available environment variables, please read the {2}.
settings.createUserDir: Auto create user home dir while adding new user
settings.tusUploadsHelp: File Browser supports chunked file uploads, allowing for the creation of efficient, reliable, resumable and chunked file uploads even on unreliable networks.
settings.tusUploadsChunkSize: Indicates to maximum size of a request (direct uploads will be used for smaller uploads). You may input a plain integer denoting byte size input or a string like 10MB, 1GB etc.
settings.tusUploadsRetryCount: Number of retries to perform if a chunk fails to upload.
settings.userHomeBasePath: Base path for user home directories
settings.userScopeGenerationPlaceholder: The scope will be auto generated
settings.defaultUserDescription: These are the default settings for new users.
settings.executeOnShellDescription: By default, File Browser executes the commands by calling their binaries directly. If you wish to run them on a shell instead (such as Bash or PowerShell), you can define it here with the required arguments and flags. If set, the command you execute will be appended as an argument. This applies to both user commands and event hooks.
settings.globalRules: This is a global set of allow and disallow rules. They apply to every user. You can define specific rules on each user's settings to override these ones.
settings.lockPassword: Prevent the user from changing the password

perm.rename: Rename or move files and directories

settings.permissionsHelp: You can set the user to be an administrator or choose the permissions individually. If you select "Administrator", all of the other options will be automatically checked. The management of users remains a privilege of an administrator.
settings.ruleExample1: prevents the access to any dotfile (such as .git, .gitignore) in every folder.
settings.ruleExample2: blocks the access to the file named Caddyfile on the root of the scope.
settings.rulesHelp: Here you can define a set of allow and disallow rules for this specific user. The blocked files won't show up in the listings and they wont be accessible to the user. We support regex and paths relative to the users scope.
settings.singleClick: Use single clicks to open files and directories
settings.userCommandsHelp: A space separated list with the available commands for this user. Example:
